pull.title: ZMQ: Support UNIX domain sockets
pull.body:
This is a follow-up to https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/27375, allowing ZMQ notifications to be published to a UNIX domain socket, adding one more commit.

Fortunately, libzmq handles unix sockets already, all we really have to do to support it is allow the format in the actual option. libzmq uses the prefix `ipc://` as opposed to `unix:` which is used by Tor and by #27375 so, for now I'm testing with both being allowed. 

Example:

`bitcoind -zmqpubhashblock=ipc:///tmp/subscriber_socket`

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#27557](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/27557) (net: call getaddrinfo() in detachable thread to prevent stalling by pinheadmz)
* [#27411](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/27411) (p2p: Restrict self-advertisements with privacy networks to avoid fingerprinting by mzumsande)
* [#27375](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/27375) (net: support unix domain sockets for -proxy and -onion by pinheadmz)
* [#27071](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/27071) (Handle CJDNS from LookupSubNet() by vasild)
* [#26261](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/26261) (p2p: cleanup `LookupIntern`, `Lookup` and `LookupHost` by brunoerg)
* [#25284](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/25284) (net: Use serialization parameters for CAddress serialization by MarcoFalke)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.

test: skip zmq unix socket test on Windows

Although modern versions of Windows do support UNIX sockets, there
are issues with the python bindings:

https://pyzmq.readthedocs.io/en/latest/changelog.html#id7
https://github.com/zeromq/libzmq/pull/3717
https://github.com/zeromq/libzmq/releases/tag/v4.3.3
